article:
The 'Global 200' is the list of ecoregions identified by WWF, the global
conservation organization, as priorities for conservation. According to WWF, an
ecoregion is defined as a "relatively large unit of land or water containing a
characteristic set of natural communities that share a large majority of their
species, dynamics, and environmental conditions (Olson & Dinerstein 1998, 2002;
TNC 1997)."

The WWF assigns a conservation status to each ecoregion in the Global 200:
'critical or endangered'; 'vulnerable'; and 'relatively stable or intact'. Over
half of the ecoregions in the Global 200 are rated endangered.
